intro: Dianthera calycina, commonly known as the pink-flowered dianthera, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are ovate and have a hairy texture, while its stems are often reddish in color. Dianthera calycina is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
